TLSv1.0.description: TLSv1.0 is a deprecated encryption protocol that lacks modern security features.
TLSv1.0.remediation: Upgrade to TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.3. A WAF can enforce secure protocols by terminating TLS connections and redirecting traffic through secure channels.

TLSv1.1.description: TLSv1.1 is a deprecated encryption protocol that lacks modern security features.
TLSv1.1.remediation: Upgrade to TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.3. A WAF can enforce secure protocols by terminating TLS connections and redirecting traffic through secure channels.

X-Powered-By.description: The X-Powered-By header reveals server-side technologies, which can aid attackers in targeting known vulnerabilities.
X-Powered-By.remediation: Remove or obfuscate the X-Powered-By header. A WAF can help sanitize HTTP headers before they reach the client.

Outdated Apache.description: The target is running an outdated version of the Apache web server, which may contain known vulnerabilities.
Outdated Apache.remediation: Update to the latest stable version of Apache. A WAF can provide virtual patching to mitigate known exploits until updates are applied.

csp-implemented-with-unsafe-inline.description: The Content Security Policy (CSP) allows 'unsafe-inline' scripts or styles, which can expose the application to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
csp-implemented-with-unsafe-inline.remediation: Refactor inline scripts and styles to use external resources with integrity checks. A WAF can help mitigate XSS risks by inspecting and filtering malicious payloads in HTTP requests.

sri-not-implemented-but-external-scripts.description: External scripts are loaded over HTTPS but lack Subresource Integrity (SRI) attributes, which help ensure the integrity of third-party resources.
sri-not-implemented-but-external-scripts.remediation: Add SRI attributes to all externally loaded scripts and styles. A WAF can monitor and block tampered resources or suspicious third-party requests.

x-frame-options-header-invalid.description: The X-Frame-Options header is present but misconfigured, potentially allowing clickjacking attacks via iframe embedding.
x-frame-options-header-invalid.remediation: Correct the X-Frame-Options header to 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN'. A WAF can enforce proper header policies and block framing attempts from unauthorized sources.

No WAF Detected.description: No Web Application Firewall (WAF) was detected protecting the target. This may leave the application exposed to a wide range of attacks.
No WAF Detected.remediation: Deploy a WAF in front of the application to provide an additional layer of security against common web attacks.

WAF Check Inconclusive.description: The presence of a Web Application Firewall (WAF) could not be reliably determined. This may be due to evasive WAF configurations or network issues.
WAF Check Inconclusive.remediation: Review network architecture and WAF configuration. Consider using multiple detection methods to confirm WAF presence.

cookies-session-without-secure-flag.description: A session cookie is set without the 'Secure' flag, allowing it to be transmitted over unencrypted connections.
cookies-session-without-secure-flag.remediation: Set the 'Secure' flag on all session cookies to ensure they are only sent over HTTPS. A WAF can enforce cookie security policies by rewriting cookie headers to include the Secure flag.

cookies-without-secure-flag.description: One or more cookies are set without the 'Secure' flag, increasing the risk of interception over unencrypted connections.
cookies-without-secure-flag.remediation: Set the 'Secure' flag on all cookies to ensure they are only sent over HTTPS. A WAF can enforce cookie security policies by rewriting cookie headers to include the Secure flag.

csp-not-implemented.description: No Content Security Policy (CSP) is present, leaving the application more vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) and other code injection attacks.
csp-not-implemented.remediation: Implement a strong Content Security Policy header to restrict the sources of scripts, styles, and other resources. A WAF can inject a default Content Security Policy header to provide immediate protection against XSS attacks.

hsts-header-invalid.description: The HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header is present but misconfigured, which may prevent proper enforcement of HTTPS-only connections.
hsts-header-invalid.remediation: Correct the HSTS header to include a valid 'max-age' and consider adding 'includeSubDomains' and 'preload' directives. A WAF can correct or inject a properly configured HSTS header to enforce secure connections.

hsts-implemented-max-age-less-than-six-m.display_name: HSTS Max-Age Less Than Six Months
hsts-implemented-max-age-less-than-six-m.description: The HSTS header is implemented but the 'max-age' value is less than the recommended six months, reducing its effectiveness.
hsts-implemented-max-age-less-than-six-m.remediation: Set the HSTS 'max-age' directive to at least 15768000 seconds (six months) for better protection. A WAF can rewrite the HSTS header to enforce a longer max-age value.

hsts-invalid-cert.description: HSTS is enabled but the SSL/TLS certificate is invalid, which can cause browsers to block access and reduce user trust.
hsts-invalid-cert.remediation: Ensure a valid, trusted SSL/TLS certificate is installed when using HSTS. A WAF can terminate TLS connections with valid certificates while the backend certificate is being updated.

hsts-not-implemented.description: The HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header is not present, allowing browsers to connect over insecure HTTP.
hsts-not-implemented.remediation: Implement the HSTS header to enforce HTTPS connections and protect against protocol downgrade attacks. A WAF can inject the HSTS header to enforce HTTPS connections and protect against protocol downgrade attacks.

redirection-off-host-from-http.description: HTTP requests are redirected to a different host, which may expose users to phishing or man-in-the-middle attacks.
redirection-off-host-from-http.remediation: Review and restrict HTTP redirections to trusted hosts only. A WAF can help enforce safe redirection policies.

redirection-missing.description: The site does not automatically redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS, allowing users to access the site over unencrypted connections. This exposes users to man-in-the-middle attacks and credential theft.
redirection-missing.remediation: Configure the web server to automatically redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS using 301 (permanent) or 302 (temporary) redirects. A WAF can enforce automatic HTTP-to-HTTPS redirection to ensure all traffic is encrypted.

redirection-not-to-https-on-initial-redi.display_name: Redirection Not to HTTPS on Initial Redirection
redirection-not-to-https-on-initial-redi.description: The initial HTTP redirection does not redirect to an HTTPS URL. This means the first hop from HTTP may go to another HTTP URL before eventually reaching HTTPS, leaving the initial request vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks.
redirection-not-to-https-on-initial-redi.remediation: Configure the web server to redirect HTTP requests directly to the HTTPS version of the URL on the first redirection. Ensure no intermediate HTTP hops exist in the redirection chain. A WAF can enforce immediate HTTPS redirection to eliminate insecure intermediate hops.

referrer-policy-unsafe.description: The Referrer-Policy header is missing or set to an unsafe value, potentially leaking sensitive information in HTTP requests.
referrer-policy-unsafe.remediation: Set a strict Referrer-Policy header such as 'no-referrer' or 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin'. A WAF can inject or override the Referrer-Policy header to prevent information leakage.

sri-not-implemented-and-external-scripts.display_name: SRI Not Implemented and External Scripts Not Loaded Securely
sri-not-implemented-and-external-scripts.description: External scripts are loaded without Subresource Integrity (SRI) and not all are loaded over secure (HTTPS) connections, increasing the risk of resource tampering.
sri-not-implemented-and-external-scripts.remediation: Load all external scripts over HTTPS and add SRI attributes to ensure resource integrity. A WAF can monitor external script requests and block suspicious or tampered resources.

high-external-script-count.description: Website loads an excessive number of external JavaScript files (>10), increasing attack surface, dependency risk, and potential for supply chain attacks.
high-external-script-count.remediation: Review and minimize external script dependencies. Bundle scripts when possible, implement SRI for all external scripts, use CSP to restrict script sources, and regularly audit third-party dependencies. A WAF can monitor and enforce policies on external script loading.

x-content-type-options-not-implemented.description: The X-Content-Type-Options header is missing, which can allow browsers to perform MIME type sniffing and potentially execute malicious files.
x-content-type-options-not-implemented.remediation: Add the X-Content-Type-Options header with the value 'nosniff' to prevent MIME type sniffing. A WAF can inject the X-Content-Type-Options header to prevent MIME type sniffing attacks.

x-content-type-options-header-invalid.description: The X-Content-Type-Options header is present but misconfigured with an invalid value. This header should only be set to 'nosniff' to prevent MIME type sniffing attacks. An invalid configuration may fail to protect against MIME type confusion vulnerabilities.
x-content-type-options-header-invalid.remediation: Correct the X-Content-Type-Options header to use the valid value 'nosniff'. Remove any invalid values or multiple directives. A WAF can correct or override the X-Content-Type-Options header to ensure proper MIME type protection.

x-frame-options-not-implemented.description: The X-Frame-Options header is missing, making the application vulnerable to clickjacking attacks via iframe embedding.
x-frame-options-not-implemented.remediation: Add the X-Frame-Options header with the value 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN' to protect against clickjacking. A WAF can inject the X-Frame-Options header to protect against clickjacking attacks.

cookies-anticsrf-without-samesite-flag.description: A session cookie is set without the SameSite attribute, increasing the risk of CSRF attacks.
cookies-anticsrf-without-samesite-flag.remediation: Set the SameSite attribute to Strict or Lax to restrict cross-site cookie transmission. A WAF can enforce proper cookie attributes by adding the SameSite flag to cookies before they reach the client.

cookies-samesite-flag-invalid.description: The SameSite attribute is present but misconfigured, which may not effectively prevent CSRF.
cookies-samesite-flag-invalid.remediation: Use valid values like Strict, Lax, or None with Secure for cross-site cookies. A WAF can correct invalid SameSite attributes and enforce proper cookie security policies.

cookies-session-without-httponly-flag.description: A session cookie is set without the HttpOnly flag, making it accessible via client-side scripts.
cookies-session-without-httponly-flag.remediation: Set the HttpOnly flag to prevent access from JavaScript and reduce XSS risks. A WAF can enforce the HttpOnly flag by rewriting cookie headers to prevent client-side script access.

cookies-session-without-secure-flag-but-.display_name: Session Cookie Without Secure Flag but Protected by HSTS
cookies-session-without-secure-flag-but-.description: A session cookie lacks the Secure flag but is transmitted over HTTPS due to HSTS.
cookies-session-without-secure-flag-but-.remediation: Set the Secure flag explicitly to ensure cookie transmission only over HTTPS. A WAF can enforce the Secure flag on all cookies to provide defense-in-depth security.

cookies-without-secure-flag-but-protecte.display_name: Cookie Without Secure Flag but Protected by HSTS
cookies-without-secure-flag-but-protecte.description: One or more cookies lack the Secure flag but are transmitted over HTTPS due to HSTS.
cookies-without-secure-flag-but-protecte.remediation: Set the Secure flag explicitly on all cookies to ensure transmission only over HTTPS. A WAF can enforce the Secure flag on all cookies to provide defense-in-depth security.

exposed_admin_panel.description: An administrative login page or panel is publicly accessible, potentially allowing attackers to attempt brute-force attacks or exploit authentication vulnerabilities.
exposed_admin_panel.remediation: Restrict access to admin panels using IP allowlisting, VPN requirements, or move to a non-public subdomain. Implement strong authentication, rate limiting, and monitor for unauthorized access attempts. A WAF can restrict access to admin panels using IP allow-listing and other access control policies to provide immediate protection.

csp-not-implemented-but-reporting-enable.display_name: CSP Not Implemented but Reporting Enabled
csp-not-implemented-but-reporting-enable.description: Content Security Policy is configured in report-only mode but not enforced, leaving the application vulnerable to XSS and code injection attacks while only logging violations.
csp-not-implemented-but-reporting-enable.remediation: Convert the CSP from report-only mode to enforcement mode after reviewing violation reports. A WAF can inject and enforce a Content Security Policy header to provide immediate protection against XSS attacks.

LUCKY13.description: The server is vulnerable to the LUCKY13 timing attack against CBC-mode cipher suites in TLS. This vulnerability allows attackers to potentially decrypt encrypted traffic through careful timing analysis.
LUCKY13.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites and prefer AEAD ciphers like AES-GCM or ChaCha20-Poly1305. Update TLS configuration to use only modern, secure cipher suites. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable weak CBC-mode cipher suites, providing immediate protection.

cipher-tls1_2_xc028.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384) which is considered weak and vulnerable to certain attacks including LUCKY13.
cipher-tls1_2_xc028.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites in favor of AEAD ciphers. Configure the server to use only strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 or TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc027.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256) which is considered weak and vulnerable to certain attacks including LUCKY13.
cipher-tls1_2_xc027.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites in favor of AEAD ciphers. Configure the server to use only strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 or TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

BREACH.description: The server is potentially vulnerable to BREACH (Browser Reconnaissance and Exfiltration via Adaptive Compression of Hypertext) attack. HTTP compression (gzip, deflate, compress, br) is enabled, which can allow attackers to extract sensitive information from encrypted connections through compression-based side-channel attacks.
BREACH.remediation: Disable HTTP compression for sensitive data, implement CSRF tokens, add random padding to responses, or use length-hiding techniques. A WAF can help mitigate BREACH risks by implementing countermeasures such as disabling compression for sensitive endpoints or adding random padding to responses.

SWEET32.description: The server uses 64-bit block ciphers (such as 3DES) which are vulnerable to SWEET32 birthday attacks. Attackers can potentially recover plaintext from encrypted traffic after observing sufficient encrypted data.
SWEET32.remediation: Disable 64-bit block ciphers (3DES, Blowfish) and use only modern ciphers with 128-bit or larger block sizes (AES, ChaCha20). A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable vulnerable 64-bit block ciphers.

cipher-tls1_2_xc014.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA) which is considered weak and vulnerable to attacks including LUCKY13 and BEAST.
cipher-tls1_2_xc014.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites in favor of AEAD ciphers. Configure the server to use only strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc077.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_256_CBC_SHA384) which is considered weak and vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_xc077.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites and Camellia ciphers in favor of modern AEAD ciphers (AES-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305). A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x3d.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256) using RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x3d.remediation: Disable CBC-mode and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with AEAD ciphers for forward secrecy. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x35.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA) using RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x35.remediation: Disable CBC-mode and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with AEAD ciphers for forward secrecy. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc0.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_256_CBC_SHA256) with RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_xc0.remediation: Disable CBC-mode, Camellia, and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with modern AEAD ciphers. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x84.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_256_CBC_SHA) with RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x84.remediation: Disable CBC-mode, Camellia, and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with modern AEAD ciphers. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc013.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA) which is considered weak and vulnerable to attacks including LUCKY13 and BEAST.
cipher-tls1_2_xc013.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites in favor of AEAD ciphers. Configure the server to use only strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc076.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_128_CBC_SHA256) which is considered weak and vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_xc076.remediation: Disable CBC-mode cipher suites and Camellia ciphers in favor of modern AEAD ciphers (AES-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305). A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x3c.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256) using RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x3c.remediation: Disable CBC-mode and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with AEAD ciphers for forward secrecy. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x2f.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA) using RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x2f.remediation: Disable CBC-mode and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with AEAD ciphers for forward secrecy. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xba.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_128_CBC_SHA256) with RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_xba.remediation: Disable CBC-mode, Camellia, and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with modern AEAD ciphers. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x41.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_128_CBC_SHA) with RSA key exchange, which lacks forward secrecy and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x41.remediation: Disable CBC-mode, Camellia, and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with modern AEAD ciphers. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc012.description: The server supports 3DES (Triple DES) cipher suite (TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA) which uses 64-bit block ciphers vulnerable to SWEET32 birthday attacks and CBC-mode vulnerabilities.
cipher-tls1_2_xc012.remediation: Disable 3DES and all CBC-mode cipher suites. Use modern AEAD ciphers (AES-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305) with 128-bit or larger block sizes. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x0a.description: The server supports 3DES (Triple DES) cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA) using RSA key exchange, which uses 64-bit block ciphers vulnerable to SWEET32 attacks, lacks forward secrecy, and is vulnerable to CBC-mode attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x0a.remediation: Disable 3DES, CBC-mode, and RSA key exchange cipher suites. Use ECDHE key exchange with modern AEAD ciphers for forward secrecy and strong encryption. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x6b.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256) using DHE key exchange. While DHE provides forward secrecy, it is slower and weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks including LUCKY13.
cipher-tls1_2_x6b.remediation: Disable DHE and CBC-mode cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with AEAD ciphers. Configure the server to use strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 or TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x39.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA) using DHE key exchange and SHA-1 hashing. While DHE provides forward secrecy, it is slower and weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks including LUCKY13 and BEAST.
cipher-tls1_2_x39.remediation: Disable DHE, CBC-mode, and SHA-1 cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with AEAD ciphers and SHA-256 or better. Configure the server to use strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xc4.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_256_CBC_SHA256) with DHE key exchange. Camellia is less commonly used and vetted than AES, DHE is weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_xc4.remediation: Disable DHE, CBC-mode, and Camellia cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with modern AEAD ciphers (AES-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305). A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x88.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_256_CBC_SHA) with DHE key exchange and SHA-1 hashing. Camellia is less commonly used than AES, DHE is weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x88.remediation: Disable DHE, CBC-mode, Camellia, and SHA-1 cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with modern AEAD ciphers and SHA-256 or better. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x67.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256) using DHE key exchange. While DHE provides forward secrecy, it is slower and weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks including LUCKY13.
cipher-tls1_2_x67.remediation: Disable DHE and CBC-mode cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with AEAD ciphers. Configure the server to use strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 or TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x33.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA) using DHE key exchange and SHA-1 hashing. While DHE provides forward secrecy, it is slower and weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks including LUCKY13 and BEAST.
cipher-tls1_2_x33.remediation: Disable DHE, CBC-mode, and SHA-1 cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with AEAD ciphers and SHA-256 or better. Configure the server to use strong cipher suites like TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_xbe.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using ARIA encryption (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_ARIA_256_CBC_SHA384) with DHE key exchange. ARIA is a Korean cipher that is less commonly used and vetted than AES, DHE is weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_xbe.remediation: Disable DHE, CBC-mode, and ARIA cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with widely-vetted AEAD ciphers (AES-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305). A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.

cipher-tls1_2_x45.description: The server supports a CBC-mode cipher suite using Camellia encryption (TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_CAMELLIA_128_CBC_SHA) with DHE key exchange and SHA-1 hashing. Camellia is less commonly used than AES, DHE is weaker than ECDHE, and CBC mode is vulnerable to timing attacks.
cipher-tls1_2_x45.remediation: Disable DHE, CBC-mode, Camellia, and SHA-1 cipher suites in favor of ECDHE with modern AEAD ciphers and SHA-256 or better. A WAF can terminate TLS connections and disable this weak cipher suite.
